name: Music and fandom
description: Sometimes fans create their own amazing artworks.

key_work.title: The Beatles 1964 Australian Tour (Spectacle)
key_work.brief_description: The Beatles touched down in Sydney on June 11, 1964 and for an amazing 13 days they captivated the nation.

constellations_primary.name: Music and fandom
constellations_primary.description: Sometimes fans create their own amazing artworks.

start.title: World of Warcraft
start.brief_description:
Four years have passed since the aftermath of Warcraft III: Reign of Chaos, and a great tension now smolders throughout the ravaged world of Azeroth. As the battle-worn races begin to rebuild their shattered kingdoms, new threats, both ancient and ominous, arise to plague the world once again. World of Warcraft is an online role-playing experience set in the award-winning Warcraft universe. Players assume the roles of Warcraft heroes as they explore, adventure, and quest across a vast world. Being “Massively Multiplayer,” World of Warcraft allows thousands of players to interact within the same world. Whether adventuring together or fighting against each other in epic battles, players will form friendships, forge alliances, and compete with enemies for power and glory. A dedicated live team will create a constant stream of new adventures to undertake, lands to explore, and monsters to vanquish. This content ensures that the game will never be the same from month to month, and will continue to offer new challenges and adventures for years to come.

This game has a monthly online fee. Adventure together with thousands of other players simultaneously. Explore an expansive world with miles of forests, deserts, snow-blown mountains, and other exotic lands. Join the Horde or the Alliance as one of 8 playable races. Select from 9 classes, including holy Paladins, shape-shifting Druids, powerful Warriors and Mages, demon-summoning Warlocks, and more. Encounter many familiar and new Warcraft characters and monsters. Learn the continuing story of Azeroth by completing a wide variety of challenging quests. Journey through an epic world filled with dungeons of different styles and depths. Explore 6 huge capital cities, which serve as major hubs for the races inhabiting them. Practice various trade skills to help locate reagents, make and enhance custom items, acquire wealth through trade with other players, and more. Purchase tickets for travel along a number of air routes flown by creatures such as Gryphons and Wyverns. For global transportation, travel by Boat or Goblin Zeppelin. Once a certain level has been achieved, players can choose to purchase permanent personal mounts, such as Dire Wolves and Horses. Establish a guild, purchase a custom guild tabard, and promote or demote recruits to different ranks within the guild. Locate and engage other players with easy-to-use features and tools, including chat channels, friends lists, and animated and audible character expressions. Customize the game’s interface via XML. Enjoy hundreds of hours of gameplay with new quests, items, and adventures every month.

constellations_other.name: Music and fandom
constellations_other.description: Sometimes fans create their own amazing artworks.

constellations_other.name: From Cute to Evil
constellations_other.description: In The Cute Machine, players are rewarded by making characters with the most juvenile or baby-ish features. Explore how broader screen works uphold or disrupt the idea that characters with cute traits are inherently good and those without are evil.

constellations_other.name: Mayes C Rubeo
constellations_other.description: Emmy-award winning and Oscar-nominated costume designer Mayes C Rubeo has worked on some of Hollywood's biggest blockbusters, designing costumes for characters and creatures across time, space and everything in between.

end.title: Leeeeeerooooooy Jenkins!
end.material_description: Screen recording of J Jonah Jameson's YouTube channel
end.brief_description:
In 2005, a World of Warcraft player character Leeroy Jenkins (played by Ben Schulz) became an internet legend. While his team carefully planned a battle, Leeroy – who was AFK (away from keyboard) making chicken – charged in shouting his own name. Chaos followed. This viral moment spread beyond the game and still make the rounds on TikTok today. Blizzard officially added Leeroy as a non-playable character, a card, and even an achievement. His name became shorthand for recnkless bravery (or foolishness).

It was later revealed that the viral moment was staged by a group of friends – but the fact it’s still being spoken about 20 years later stands testament to its legacy.

constellations_other.name: Music and fandom
constellations_other.description: Sometimes fans create their own amazing artworks.

links.description: Perhaps one of the most recogniseable moments in World of Warcraft came during a raid in 2005. As his friends meticulously planned their attack, Leeroy Jenkins was making chicken. When he returned, and charged into battle, a meme was born.

start.title: The Beatles 1964 Australian Tour (Spectacle)
start.brief_description: The Beatles touched down in Sydney on June 11, 1964 and for an amazing 13 days they captivated the nation.

end.title: A Hard Day's Night
end.creator_credit: Julie Harris, Denis O'Dell, Walter Shenson and United Artists
end.brief_description: Capturing John Lennon, Paul McCartney, George Harrison and Ringo Starr in their electrifying element, A Hard Day’s Night is a wildly irreverent journey through this pastiche of a day in the life of The Beatles during 1964.

constellations_other.name: Music and fandom
constellations_other.description: Sometimes fans create their own amazing artworks.

links.description: During their tour to Australia in 1964, The Beatles were mobbed by thousands of hysterical fans. This type of event was becoming commonplace for them, and formed the comic opening scenes to their hit film ‘A Hard Day’s Night’.

start.title: Yes: 9012 Live
start.creator_credit: Tony Dimitriades and Warner Music UK
start.brief_description: 9012Live is a concert film featuring the English rock band Yes, recorded at Northlands Coliseum in Edmonton, Alberta, Canada on 28 and 29 September 1984 on the band’s tour in support of their eleventh studio album, 90125.

constellations_other.name: Music and fandom
constellations_other.description: Sometimes fans create their own amazing artworks.

end.title: Dr. Horrible's Sing-Along Blog
end.creator_credit: David M. Burns, Joss Whedon and Michael Boretz
end.headline_credit: United States of America and US, 2008
end.brief_description: Aspiring super-villain Dr. Horrible wants to join the Evil League of Evil and win the girl of his dreams, but his nemesis, Captain Hammer, stops him at every turn.

constellations_other.name: Music and fandom
constellations_other.description: Sometimes fans create their own amazing artworks.

links.description: Joss Whedon, whose works have large and passionate fandoms, was himself a huge fan of Yes, and created many musical episodes and specials. This including the award-winning ‘Dr Horrible’s Sing-Along Blog’. His production company, Mutant Enemy, was also named after a lyric from the Yes song ‘And You And I’.

start.title: The Guild
start.creator_credit: Kristin Ingram, Jeff Winkler and Greg Aronowitz
start.brief_description: The Guild is an American comedy web series created and written by Felicia Day, who also stars as Cyd Sherman. It premiered on YouTube on July 27, 2007.

constellations_other.name: Music and fandom
constellations_other.description: Sometimes fans create their own amazing artworks.

constellations_other.name: From Cute to Evil
constellations_other.description: In The Cute Machine, players are rewarded by making characters with the most juvenile or baby-ish features. Explore how broader screen works uphold or disrupt the idea that characters with cute traits are inherently good and those without are evil.

constellations_other.name: Mayes C Rubeo
constellations_other.description: Emmy-award winning and Oscar-nominated costume designer Mayes C Rubeo has worked on some of Hollywood's biggest blockbusters, designing costumes for characters and creatures across time, space and everything in between.

links.description: ‘The Guild’ follows Cyd Sherman (Felicia Day) and her obsessive experiences with an MMORPG called The Game. Day created the series after her own experiences with addiction to ‘World of Warcraft’, on which The Game is based, and it presents a satiric look at some of the negative effects of fandom. ‘World of Warcraft’ itself has a large international fandom, with international conventions (Blizzcon) dedicated to it.

end.title: Yes: 9012 Live

end.brief_description: 9012Live is a concert film featuring the English rock band Yes, recorded at Northlands Coliseum in Edmonton, Alberta, Canada on 28 and 29 September 1984 on the band’s tour in support of their eleventh studio album, 90125.

constellations_other.name: Music and fandom
constellations_other.description: Sometimes fans create their own amazing artworks.

links.description: Iconic prog-rock band Yes inspired devotion in its fandom. Steven Soderbergh, director of this 1985 documentary / concert recording, was personally an avid fan of Richard Lester (director of A Hard Day’s Night), and cites him as one of his primary influences on this film.

start.headline_credit: United States of America and US, 2008

end.title: The Guild
end.creator_credit: Kristin Ingram, Jeff Winkler and Greg Aronowitz
end.brief_description: The Guild is an American comedy web series created and written by Felicia Day, who also stars as Cyd Sherman. It premiered on YouTube on July 27, 2007.

constellations_other.name: Music and fandom
constellations_other.description: Sometimes fans create their own amazing artworks.

links.description: In creating ‘Dr Horrible’s Sing-Along Blog’, Joss Whedon was hugely influenced by award-winning web series ‘The Guild’. Created by and starring Felicia Day (also a star in Dr Horrible), ‘The Guild’ explores fandoms of massive multiplayer online games (MMORPG). The score for both was also written by Joss’ brother Jed Whedon.
